intro: Pituranthos battandieri subsp. abbreviatus, commonly known as the dwarf rock-rose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, compact growth habit makes it well-suited for rock gardens and container cultivation. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the summer months.
